alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes; Muskogee; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:47AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rogers, southwestern Delaware, Mayes, northwestern Adair, eastern Wagoner, Cherokee and northern Muskogee Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 647 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southeast of Foyil to 7 miles south of Chouteau to 5 miles south of Taft. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Tahlequah... Wagoner... Jay... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Fort Gibson... Chouteau... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Kansas... Adair... Okay... Hulbert... Porter... Spavinaw... Foyil... Disney... Oaks... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 255 and 268. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes; Muskogee; Rogers; Wagoner
